Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scaraboid
Description: The upper face of this scaraboid features a monkey in profile. The body, hairy, and the right hind leg occupy most of the surface. The right fore arm is bent, the hand on the knee, and is reduced to a thin line. In the same way, the head, although easily recognizable, is much reduced, which accentuates the disproportionate, but very elegant aspect of this representation. The reverse consists only of a spiral edge and the sign neb ("lord, all, each").
